a.h2: Special counsel requests to muzzle Trump in docs case
a.p: Special counsel Jack Smith on Friday asked the judge overseeing Donald Trump's classified documents case to prevent the defendants from sharing any evidence with the public.
Judge refers motion to federal magistrate »

Biden ends speech by saying 'God save the queen, man'

div.a: NBA suspends Ja Morant for 25 games for latest gun incident
div.p: The league "uncovered a fair amount of additional information" during its investigation, commissioner Adam Silver said during his annual state-of-the-league address prior to Game 1 between the Denver Nuggets and Miami Heat.

div.a: Jeffrey Epstein paid college tuition for the kids of the former first lady of the Virgin Islands, and she asked him for his input on the wording of a sex offender law: JPMorgan
div.p: De Jongh asked Epstein to approve tuition for Skidmore College, and consulted him on language in a sex offender registration bill, per court filings.

div.a: 'It was a mess': Ugly U.S.-Mexico match halted after 4 ejections, brawls and anti-gay chant
div.p: The match devolved into a cauldron of danger and chaos, of hate unrestrained and anger uncontrolled. Mexico instigated much of it. The Americans, though, couldn't refrain from getting involved.

div.a: Money market account vs. high-yield savings account: Which account is best for you?
div.p: When deciding between money market accounts vs. high-yield savings accounts, they differ in terms of APYs, fees, and minimum deposits.

div.a: What is a CD early withdrawal penalty?
div.p: CD rates are generally higher than traditional savings account rates, but CDs may have early withdrawal penalties. Here’s what to know about these penalties.

div.a: The best CD rates for June 2023
div.p: CD rates haven’t been this high in years. As the Fed pushes up interest rates, CD rates are rising too. Find the best deals and rates on CDs.

div.p: Opening a high-yield savings account is relatively simple, and adding one to your portfolio is a good way to maximize your savings.

div.a: A Michigan school cut a 7-year-old biracial girl's hair, but she won in the end
div.p: Yahoo News spoke to Jurnee Hoffmeyer about hair discrimination — a day before Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer signed the Crown Act into law, making Michigan the 20th state to ban discrimination based on natural hair texture in the workplace and at school.

div.a: Arkansas lands Tarleton State transfer Jack Wagner
div.p: With two portal commits already in the fold, the Arkansas baseball team landed a third Friday in Tarleton State transfer first baseman Jack Wagner.Wagner joins Texas Tech transfer Hudson White and Missouri transfer Ty Wilmsmeyer as the third addition via the portal for the Diamond Hogs so far.After visiting Arkansas on Tuesday, Wagner decided the time was right to make his commitment decision.

div.a: Michael Cera says he and 'Scott Pilgrim' costar Aubrey Plaza almost 'spontaneously' got married in Vegas so they could get divorced 'right away'
div.p: The "Barbie" star recalled the time he and Plaza "almost just spontaneously took a detour and got married" in a new interview with Rolling Stone.

div.a: Trump lawyer who bailed on documents case says in separate lawsuit he is withdrawing due to ‘irreconcilable differences’
div.p: A lawyer who was representing former President Donald Trump in his defamation lawsuit against CNN said Friday that he was withdrawing from the case, in the latest sign of the break-up of the Trump legal team since the lawyer, Jim Trusty, and another Trump attorney stopped representing the former president in the criminal documents case against him.

div.a: Donald Trump Just Got Dumped by His Lawyer Again
div.p: Reuters/Amr AlfikyDonald Trump is bleeding lawyers as quickly as he needs them, with Jim Trusty—once representing the former president in both his criminal documents case and a defamation lawsuit—motioning to end his relationship with Trump altogether on Friday. Trusty wrote in a motion that he was dropping Trump as a client in his defamation suit against CNN because of “irreconcilable differences” that made it impossible for him to “effectively and properly represent” him. “The defamation lawsu

div.a: Bali is trying to regain control of its tourists by closing mountains and banning ‘bonking’
div.p: It seems that hardly a day goes by without reports of another tourist offending local customs on Bali. There are bikini-clad yoginis doing ‘downward dog’ poses in temple gateways and half-naked hooligans arguing with traffic police over their lack of a crash-helmet. While the world asks what’s caused this sudden rush of inappropriate behaviour, travellers who know the island well are wondering why it’s taken so long for Balinese to stand up and say, “enough is enough!”

div.a: The Latest Estimate Is In: Here's How Much Social Security Benefits Are Expected to Rise In 2024
div.p: Social Security checks rose by 8.7% in 2023. Next year's increase looks to be considerably smaller.
